args: In a cave on the edge of the village, several days\nafter the fiery whirlwind faded...
Can't feel my feet, but it doesn't matter.\nHow's the village?
There were no fatalities, but a third of the\nbuildings were reduced to rubble.

Of greater concern, however, are the crops.
The fields were destroyed, and it seems
rather unlikely that these people will be
able to survive the winter.

I can practically smell the crispy flesh
from those burns of yours—you really
should be resting in the village and
not on the floor of this damp cave.
I ain't got the right. I'm the reason\nthose people are gonna suffer.
But there's no reason for you to stick\naround and let me hold you back.
Ah, but I have not yet finished studying\nthe Jiu Chi Dingba. So until that time,\nlet me go pick you some medicinal herbs.
Keep that thing away from me.\nI got no right to use it.
I set out to achieve something great,\nand all I did was make a giant mess.
I told you to leave me, Sha Wujing,\nso just... Wait, it's YOU!
I heard rumors of a village's destruction\nand suspected the Jiu Chi Dingba was\nthe cause. It seems I was correct.
Oh, you were correct, all right.\n...About everything.
Just take the damn thing already.
Believe me, I intend to.\nBut first, your wounds need—
Spare me the pity. I reaped what I sowed.
Here is a special Qilin balm that\nshould heal those burns.
Keep it for someone who deserves it.
Don't be absurd. Now let me see—
I said I don't need your help!
A person's worth is decided by what they\nachieve in life, and I achieved NOTHING!
Best thing for the world and everyone in\nit would be for me to just...disappear.
First you want to be a hero,\nand now you want to be dead.
Pitiful, right? Now if you don't mind,\nI got some sorrows to wallow in here.

I'm afraid I can't do that. Preventing relic
misuse is a sealer's responsibility, and
all of this occurred because I proved
unable to stop you.
I have a duty to make amends.
It is the Xiang Tong Hu—a relic used by\nthe ancient Qilin to convey emotions.
O power universal, hear my decree!\nGreat messenger, distant fragrance,\ndeliver the thoughts of those afar!
There's a voice comin' from it!
Listen closely, and you will hear the\nvoice of the one who loves you most.
There there, dear. It was just a nightmare.
That sounds like the wife...\nBut who's that with her?
Your father is a mighty general\nnamed Zhu Bajie.
So the reason she's been sick lately...
Is because she was with child, it seems.
So when she wanted to talk, it wasn't to\nleave me. It was because...because she...
Oh, I know they all call him a good-for-\nnothing who left me without even\nbothering to saying goodbye...
But my husband is a kind man who will\nstand up and fight for others.
No! Don't say that! I can handle everyone\nelse misunderstanding me, but not YOU!
I ain't half the man you think I am!\nI'm a childish, selfish, arrogant, loser!
Everyone says that we should go\nstart a new life elsewhere...
And they're right! So hate me!\nForget about me!
But I will keep waiting, because I know\nhe'll come back some day. You feel that\ntoo, don't you, Son?
I ain't worth all this trouble!
If you were to die here, your wife would\ncontinue waiting until the end of her days.
...I wonder how she'd react if she saw me\nlike this?
And I wonder what my son looks like...
Go and find out with your own eyes.\n...I will leave the balm here.
Good to see you back on your feet,\nZhu Bajie. Those healing ointments\nof the Qilin certainly are a wonder!
You knew she came to take the relic back?
I saw her leaving the cave.\nAt first, I thought to follow her, but...
But then I saw these fields.\nLook for yourself.
What the...? There's crops growin'!\nBut I thought these were all ruined!
Master Xuan Zang used the relic's power.\nShe created wind to cultivate the land,\nthen covered it with nutrient-filled ash.
It seems that relic was originally\ncreated for farming.

What's more, crops created by the relic
grow MUCH more quickly than normal,
which means the village should have
no trouble living out the winter.
So she cleaned up after my mess.
Oh, and incidentally, Master Xuan Zang\nalso asked that we both keep the\nrelic's existence a secret.
If word were to get out, scalawags\nthe world over would crawl forth out\nof the muck seeking its power.
Well, she ain't wrong—but since when\ndid you start callin' her ＂master＂?
The sight of her using that relic\nhas enraptured my heart!

I have learned something from all this:
If I wish to understand and use the
mighty technology of relics elsewhere,
I must be able to use them myself.
And to that end, what better person\nto study under than Master Xuan Zang?!

First, I intend to return to the organization
and study so that I might not be a burden.
But one day, I will go back to her and ask
to become her apprentice.
By the way, I'm planning to stay here and\nhelp rebuild the village, and it'd sure help\nto have a smart guy like you around.
Very well—so long as you help me\nwith my next weapon experiment!
But what will you do after\nyour rebuilding is over?
I'm heading back to Taiwu—I've got a\nwife and son to beg forgiveness from.
